com.ikalagaming.crypto

Class Hasher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.crypto.Hasher

  • public class Hasher
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows for hashing of data.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HASH_BYTE_SIZE
      The size of the hash, measured in bytes.
      static int ITERATION_INDEX
      The index of the iteration count in the hash string.
      static java.lang.String PBKDF2_ALGORITHM
      The string name of the algorithm to use (PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1).
      static int PBKDF2_INDEX
      The index of the hash in the hash string.
      static int PBKDF2_ITERATIONS
      Iteration count is the number of times that the password is hashed during the derivation of the symmetric key.
      static int SALT_BYTE_SIZE
      The size of the salt, measured in bytes.
      static int SALT_INDEX
      The index of the salt in the hash string.

      • PBKDF2_ITERATIONS

        public static final int PBKDF2_ITERATIONS
        Iteration count is the number of times that the password is hashed during the derivation of the symmetric key. The higher number, the more difficult it is to brute force the key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ITERATION_INDEX

        public static final int ITERATION_INDEX
        The index of the iteration count in the hash string.

    • Method Detail

      • createHash

        public static java.lang.String createHash(char[] password)
                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Returns a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password using a random salt.
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash
        Returns:
        a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if a nonexistent algorithm was used
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the keyspec is wrong

      • createHash

        public static java.lang.String createHash(char[] password,
                                          byte[] salt)
                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Returns a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password using the provided salt.
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash
        salt - the salt to use
        Returns:
        a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if a nonexistent algorithm was used
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the keyspec is wrong

      • validatePassword

        public static boolean validatePassword(char[] password,
                                       java.lang.String correctHash)
                                throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                       java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Validates a password using a hash.
        Parameters:
        password - the password to check
        correctHash - the hash of the valid password
        Returns:
        true if the password is correct, false if not
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if a nonexistent algorithm was used
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if the keyspec is wrong
